page.title: 02Housing in Morchard Bishop
page.content: There is a mixture of old,new,private and state housing here.A collection of council owned houses is situated at either end of the village and although most are rented from the council,some are being purchased by the sitting tenants.A close of some modern 30 bungalows was built on the site of the old Rectory garden.These are all owner occupied. The east side of Fore Street is made up of an unbroken line of 13 two hundred year old thatched cottages, the longest line of unbroken thatch in the country.Many of the old cottages in the area have been tastefully restored.These were originally tied cottages sold off by the farmers and the Church.
